title.narrative: 3.4 COVID19 REPONSE

description.narrative: 3.4 National covid19 response takes into account the needs those who are most vulnerable including children, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas (Covid), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Social Protection (Covid), Supply And Logistics (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country programme is effectively supported to make the systems accountable to children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.4 National covid19 response takes into account the needs those who are most vulnerable including children

description.narrative: Since the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic in March 2020, UNICEF has stepped in to support Tunisia National Response Plan in line with UNICEF global accountabilities, contributing to key achievements in the following areas: i) Risk Communication and Community Engagement (RCCE), where UNICEF has been the main actor on the sides of the Ministry of Health, in coordination with WHO; ii) Infection Prevention and Control/WASH, in which UNICEF leveraged significant partnerships and resources addressing national needs; and iii) documenting and responding to COVID-19 secondary impacts particularly in the areas of education, protection from violence and social protection | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/12/2020
